spanishExample: Ella empieza a hacer eso solo cuando tú empiezas.
englishTranslation: She starts doing that only when you start.
vocabIncluded: a: complement (e.g. ayudar a, empezar a) (preposition)
empieza: starts, he/she/it starts (Empezar, present, 3rd person)
empiezas: start, you start (Empezar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Lamentamos que él ya no viva aquí. Ahora vive cerca del mar.
englishTranslation: We’re very sorry he doesn’t live here anymore. Now he lives near the sea.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
cerca: near (adverb often used with de)
del: "of the" before a masculine noun
lamentamos: lament, we lament (Lamentar, present, 1st person plural)
viva: live, he/she/it live (Vivir, subjunctive, 3rd person)
vive: lives , he/she/it lives (Vivir, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No entiendo por qué odia esa planta.
englishTranslation: I don’t understand why he hates that plant.
vocabIncluded: entiendo: understand, I understand (Entender, present, 1st person)
odia: hates, he/she/it hates (Odiar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Empecemos, tenemos que hacerlo rápido para que él pruebe la comida.
englishTranslation: Let’s start, we have to do it (m) quickly so that he tries the food.
vocabIncluded: pruebe: try/test/taste, he/she/it try/test/taste (Probar, subjunctive, 3rd person)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: ¡Empieza! ¿No te das cuenta de que yo ya empecé?
englishTranslation: Start! Don’t you realize that I’ve already started?
vocabIncluded: darse cuenta de que: to realize (idiom)
empecé: started, I started (Empezar, preterite, 1st person)
ya: adverb meaning "anymore", "already", and a variety of other time-related things

spanishExample: Soy parte de ese grupo y salvo árboles. ¿Por qué no pruebas venir con nosotros?
englishTranslation: I’m part of that group and I save trees. Why don’t you try coming with us?
vocabIncluded: pruebas: try/test/taste, you try/test/taste (Probar, present, 2nd person)
salvo: save, I save (Salvar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Está salvo y tranquilo en el bosque porque le encanta la naturaleza.
englishTranslation: He’s safe and calm in the forest because he loves nature.
vocabIncluded: encanta: enchants, he/she/it enchants (Encantar, present, 3rd person)
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")

spanishExample: ¿Han probado ir al bosque cuando hay nieve? No creo que ella lo odie.
englishTranslation: (plural) Have you tried going to the forest when there’s snow? I don’t think she’ll hate it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
al: "to the" before a masculine noun
creo: believe, I believe (Creer, present, 1st person)
han: "have", "they have" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person plural)
hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)
odie: hate, he/she/it hate (Odiar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: ¡Salve eso de la tormenta! Está al lado de la casa.
englishTranslation: (formal) Save that from the storm! It’s beside the house.

spanishExample: Tenemos que hacerlo antes de que empiece a salir el sol.
englishTranslation: We have to do it(m)  before the sun starts to come out.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
a: complement (e.g. ayudar a, empezar a) (preposition)
empiece: start, he/she/it start (Empezar, subjunctive, 3rd person)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: ¿Por qué odias ir al río con lluvia? Si estás a salvo.
englishTranslation: Why do you hate going to the river with rain? If you’re safe.
vocabIncluded: al: "to the" before a masculine noun
odias: hate, you hate (Odiar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Ella está frente al mar, pero él está empezando a irse.
englishTranslation: She’s opposite the sea, but he’s starting to leave.
vocabIncluded: a: complement (e.g. ayudar a, empezar a) (preposition)
al: "to the" before a masculine noun
irse: any use of Ir with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to "leave"

spanishExample: No creo que odie los días con sol salvo si tiene mucho calor.
englishTranslation: I don’t think she hates sunny days except if she’s really hot.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
creo: believe, I believe (Creer, present, 1st person)
odie: hate, he/she/it hate (Odiar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Al parecer, salvó la planta que estaba junto a la mesa.
englishTranslation: Apparently, she saved the plant that was next to the table.
vocabIncluded: salvó: saved, he/she/it saved (Salvar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Él odiaba hacer eso y ahora creo que yo empiezo a odiarlo.
englishTranslation: He used to hate doing that and now I think that I’m starting to hate it (m)..
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
a: complement (e.g. ayudar a, empezar a) (preposition)
creo: believe, I believe (Creer, present, 1st person)
empiezo: start, I start (Empezar, present, 1st person)
odiaba: hated, he/she/it hated (Odiar, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Salvaste esos animales y ahora ellos empiezan a hacer lo mismo.
englishTranslation: You saved those animals and now they are starting to do the same.
vocabIncluded: "lo": "the" with no noun, as in "lo bueno"
a: complement (e.g. ayudar a, empezar a) (preposition)
empiezan: start, they start (Empezar, present, 3rd person plural)
salvaste: saved, you saved (Salvar, preterite, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Empecemos a trabajar y él vendrá cuando pruebe eso.
englishTranslation: Let’s start working and he’ll come when he tries that.
vocabIncluded: a: complement (e.g. ayudar a, empezar a) (preposition)
pruebe: try/test/taste, he/she/it try/test/taste (Probar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Lamentan que no hayamos ido a la isla porque saben que nos gusta la naturaleza.
englishTranslation: They’re very sorry we haven’t gone to the island because they know we like nature.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
gusta: likes, he/she/it likes (Gustar, present, 3rd person)
lamentan: lament, they lament (Lamentar, present, 3rd person plural)
nos: "us" as an indirect object ("to us", "for us")

spanishExample: Tiene que empezar a hacer eso, pero no prueba nada nuevo.
englishTranslation: He has to start doing that, but he doesn’t try anything new.
vocabIncluded: a: complement (e.g. ayudar a, empezar a) (preposition)
prueba: tries/tests/tastes, he/she/it tries/tests/tastes (Probar, present, 3rd person)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: ¡Empiece a hacerlo! Nosotros lo haremos durante una sola noche.
englishTranslation: (formal) Start doing it (m)! We’ll do it during just one night.
vocabIncluded: a: complement (e.g. ayudar a, empezar a) (preposition)
haremos: "will do/make", "we will do/make" (Hacer, future, 1st person plural)
un solo / una sola:  just one/ a single (idiom)

spanishExample: Lamenta que hayas tenido que hacer eso hora tras hora.
englishTranslation: He’s very sorry you’ve had to do that hour after hour.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
lamenta: laments, he/she/it laments(Lamentar, present, 3rd person)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Lo haremos cuando él empiece a darnos todas sus plantas.
englishTranslation: We’ll do it (m) when he starts giving us all his plants.
vocabIncluded: a: complement (e.g. ayudar a, empezar a) (preposition)
empiece: start, he/she/it start (Empezar, subjunctive, 3rd person)
haremos: "will do/make", "we will do/make" (Hacer, future, 1st person plural)
nos: "us" as an indirect object ("to us", "for us")

spanishExample: Odio ir al lago, me gusta más ir a la playa.
englishTranslation: I hate going to the lake; I like going to the beach more.
vocabIncluded: al: "to the" before a masculine noun
gusta: likes, he/she/it likes (Gustar, present, 3rd person)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
odio: hate, I hate (Odiar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Queremos que él salve esos animales porque ella los salva todo el tiempo.
englishTranslation: We want him to save those animals because she saves them all the time.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
salva: saves, he/she/it saves (Salvar, present, 3rd person)
salve: save, he/she/it save (Salvar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Lamento que no hayamos podido ver la luna, pero probemos mañana.
englishTranslation: I’m very sorry we haven’t been able to see the moon, but let’s try tomorrow.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
lamento: lament, I lament (Lamentar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: ¡Salva al gato! Va a haber mucha lluvia a la noche y tiene que estar en casa.
englishTranslation: Save the cat! There’s going to be a lot of rain at night and it has to be home.
vocabIncluded: al: "to the" before a masculine noun
haber: "there to be" indicating existence (Haber, infinitive)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Empezamos temprano porque habrá una gran tormenta con mucha nieve.
englishTranslation: We started early because there will be a great storm with a lot of snow.
vocabIncluded: empezamos: started, we started (Empezar, preterite, 1st person plural)
gran: "big"/"grand" when used right before a noun (adjective)
habrá: "there will be" indicating existence (Haber, future, impersonal)

spanishExample: Antes de que empieces a hablar de la isla, ¿puedo decirte por qué la odian?
englishTranslation: Before you start talking about the island, can I tell you why they hate it?
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
a: complement (e.g. ayudar a, empezar a) (preposition)
de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
empieces: start, you start (Empezar, subjunctive, 2nd person)
hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)
odian: hate, they hate (Odiar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Prueba ser fuerte ante esos problemas, nadie te va a salvar.
englishTranslation: Try out being strong in the face of problems, nobody is going to save you.
vocabIncluded: using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: ¡Pruebe la comida! Sé que no la odiaría.
englishTranslation: (formal) Try the food! I know you wouldn’t hate it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
odiaría: would hate, he/she/it would hate (Odiar, conditional, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Está probando cosas nuevas, como ir al río solo.
englishTranslation: He’s trying new things, like going to the river alone.
vocabIncluded: al: "to the" before a masculine noun

spanishExample: Me dijo que salve a esos perros y lo haremos juntos mañana.
englishTranslation: He told me to save those dogs and we’ll do it together tomorrow.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
"the personal a": using an extra "a" before a direct object when it's a person
haremos: "will do/make", "we will do/make" (Hacer, future, 1st person plural)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
salve: save, I save (Salvar, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: Quiere que probemos lo que hizo, pero empezó sin nosotros.
englishTranslation: He wants us to try what he did, but he started without us.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
empezó: started, he/she/it started (Empezar, preterite, 3rd person)
probemos: try/test/taste, we try/test/taste (Probar, subjunctive, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: No vamos a ir al lago, sino a la playa.
englishTranslation: We’re not going to go to the lake, but rather to the beach.
vocabIncluded: al: "to the" before a masculine noun
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: ¿Puedes probarlo? Siempre empezamos a pelear por eso.
englishTranslation: Can you try it? We always start fighting because of that.
vocabIncluded: a: complement (e.g. ayudar a, empezar a) (preposition)
empezamos: start, we start (Empezar, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: ¡No empieces! Sabes que él ha salvado todo eso de la tormenta.
englishTranslation: Don’t start! You know he has saved all that from the storm.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Odiaba ver la luna, pero ahora me ha empezado a gustar.
englishTranslation: I used to hate looking at the moon, but now I have started to like it.
vocabIncluded: a: complement (e.g. ayudar a, empezar a) (preposition)
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
odiaba: hated, I hated (Odiar, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: Empezaron a hacer la comida, pero la tienes que probar antes.
englishTranslation: They started making the food, but you have to try it beforehand.
vocabIncluded: a: complement (e.g. ayudar a, empezar a) (preposition)
empezaron: started, they started (Empezar, preterite, 3rd person plural)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Pruébalo; sé que te gustará estar cerca de esos árboles.
englishTranslation: Try it; I know you’ll like being near those trees.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
cerca: near (adverb often used with de)
gustará: will like, he/she/it will like (Gustar, future, 3rd person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")
